Posts.Content: Jun 24, 2014 02:43PM lily23 wrote: momcat- Were you given a radiocontrast agent prior to your MRI? It's usually given IV. If so, an enhancing lesion is one that shows up because the agent has "enhanced" it. It may very well also be benign but should be followed up as your doctor has recommended. In answer to your other question, to the best of my knowledge ADH can only be detected on biopsy. Sending you a virtual hug! May your wait time be short and all your fears unfounded.
Posts.Title: Sternum lesion? Momcat1962 Momcat1962
